standard_metadata.standard_description: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide decimals to hundredths, using concrete models or drawings and strategies based on place value, properties of operations, and/or the relationship between addition and subtraction; relate the strategy to a written method and explain the reasoning used.

hints.content: There are many ways to solve this problem. Let's see two ways we can solve it.

###Place Value  We can think in terms of hundredths:  $\begin{align} &\phantom{=}1.6 - 1.31\\\\ &=1.60 - 1.31\\\\ &=160\text{ hundredths} - 131\text{ hundredths}\\\\ &=29\text{ hundredths}\\\\ &=0.29 \end{align}$

###Place value table  Let's line up the numbers by their decimal places.   Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths - | - | - | - | -  $\blueE{1}$ | $.$ | $\blueE{6}$ | $\blueE0$ $\maroonD1$ | $.$ | $\maroonD{3}$ | $\maroonD1$  Now, let's subtract each place value column.  | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths - | - | - | - | -  | $\blueE{1}$ | $.$ | $\overset{5}{\cancel{\blueE{6}}}$ | $\overset{10}{\cancel{\blueE{0}}}$ $-$  | $\maroonD1$ | $.$ | $\maroonD{3}$ | $\maroonD1$  $\underline{~~~~}$ | $\underline{~~~~}$|  | $\underline{~~~~}$| $\underline{~~~~}$  | $0$ | $.$| $2$ | $9$

Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths - | - | - | - | -  $\blueE{1}$ | $\blueE{8}$ | $.$ | $\blueE{3}$ | $\blueE4$  | $\maroonD3$ | $.$ | $\maroonD{0}$ | $\maroonD0$  Now, let's subtract each place value column.  | Tens| Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths - | - | - | - | -  | $\blueE{1}$ | $\blueE{8}$  | $.$ | $\blueE{3}$ | $\blueE{4}$ $-$ |  | $\maroonD3$ | $.$ | $\maroonD{0}$ | $\maroonD0$ | $\underline{~~~~}$ | $\underline{~~~~}$|  | $\underline{~~~~}$| $\underline{~~~~}$ | $1$ | $5$ | $.$| $3$ | $4$
